nodes.bodyText: Although this is technically used to spread items around when dying, this could be used on a single stack - in which case it sounds like it would split the stack. I think randomToss would be a little more explicit maybe ?
The method only ever takes one stack. randomToss works, I supposed, but I can't help but wonder if there's a better term to describe it. randomToss sounds too Engrish.
spill should suffice (with comment)
Not sure what "too engrish" means here, but if you want conciseness "spill" works fine.
I think spreadItems is the clearest out of all of these. I immediately understand what it means, but I wouldn't know what "spill" or "randomToss" mean.
Let's continue using spreadItems and add a jd comment on what it means.
I very much disagree. When I saw spreadItems, my first thought was "wait, there is a way to automatically split a stack when dropping it ?".
Wait a minute. So this doesn't split the stack to throw the individual items in random directions? In that case, I agree spreadItems is a very bad name for this.
Nop, it's for adding random velocity when dropping the item (eg. For spreading the stacks around you when you die)
spew
throwRandomly
I think "scatter" is already used in yarn (ItemScatterer etc).
But it doesn't scatter the items in the stack! It only throws the stack, as a single entity, in a random direction.
That's what ItemScatterer does as well.
No, ItemScatterer takes a list of stacks and scatters them in random directions.
I'm partial towards spill
ItemScatterer -> ItemSpiller 🤔
v?
